name: Aleksis Kivi's Lea
address: Finnish Literature Society, Hallituskatu 1, Helsinki, Finland
description: A critical digitial edition of the play Lea (1869) by Aleksis Kivi (1834-1872), regarded as Finland's national author. The Finnish-only edition contains transcription, commentaries, facsimile images and scholarly journal articles. XML files are available under CC BY 4.0.

name: Aleksis Kivi's Yö ja päivä (= Night and Day)
address: Finnish Literature Society, Hallituskatu, Helsinki, Finland
description: A critical digitial edition of the play Yö ja päivä (1867) by Aleksis Kivi (1834-1872), regarded as Finland's national author. The Finnish-only edition contains transcription, commentaries, facsimile images and scholarly journal articles. XML files are available under CC BY 4.0.

name: Alfred Escher-Briefedition
address: Winterthurerstrasse 170, Zürich, Zürich, Switzerland
description: Edition der Korrespondenz von Alfred Escher (*20. Februar 1819 in Zürich; † 6. Dezember 1882)

name: Antonomaz
address: 1 rue Victor-Cousin, 75005 Paris, France
description: The Antonomaz project aims to publish the corpus of the mazarinades, a set of libelles printed during the Fronde (1648-1653) and to put them back in their production context.

name: Basler Edition der Bernoulli-Briefwechsel (BEBB)
address: Basel University Library, Schönbeinstrasse, Basel, Switzerland
description: Die BEBB ediert die Briefwechsel der Basler Mathematiker und Physiker Daniel I (1700-1782), Jacob I (1654-1655) Jacob II (1759-1789), Johann I (1667-1748), Johann II (1710-1790), Nicolaus I (1687-1759), Nicolaus II (1695-1726) Bernoulli und Jacob Hermann (1678-1733). Die auf TEI Publisher basierende Webseite ist noch in Vorbereitung.

name: Briefverkehr der Stadt St. Gallen 1400–1650
address: Stadtarchiv Vadiana, Notkerstrasse 22, St. Gallen, Switzerland
description: Edition der Missiven aus dem Stadtarchiv der Ortsbürgergemeinde St. Gallen (1400–1650)

name: Buddhist Stone Sutras in China
address: Heidelberger Akademie der Wissenschaften
description: “Linking Buddhist Stone Sutras in China to CBETA (Chinese Buddhist Electronic Text Association)” is a collaboration between the Dharma Drum Institute of Liberal Arts (DILA) and the Heidelberger Akademie der Wissenschaften

name: Bullinger Digital
address: Staatsarchiv des Kantons Zürich, Winterthurerstrasse 170, Zürich, Zürich, Switzerland
description: Briefwechsel-Korpus mit den 12‘000 überlieferten Briefen von und an den Zürcher Reformator Heinrich Bullinger (1504-1575)

name: A Catalog of Digital Scholarly Editions
address: Bergische Universität Wuppertal, Gaußstraße 20, Wuppertal, Germany
description: v 4.0, 2020ff under the direction of Patrick Sahle, with Georg Vogeler (contributions 1998ff), Jana Klinger (catalog entries 2019ff), Stephan Makowski (technical system 2020ff) and Nadine Sutor (various support 2020ff).

name: Codex Aitolahti
address: Finnish Literature Society, Hallituskatu, Helsinki, Finland
description: A digital edition of a 1640s Finnish translation of a late medieval legal codex of the Swedish kingdom, which Finland was a part of at the time. The edition contains facsimile images and transcription, and XML is available under CC BY 4.0.

name: Comparaison multilingue de Contes des frères Grimm en traduction / Multilingual comparison of tales by the Brothers Grimm in translation
address: Cyrille FRANÇOIS, Université de Lausanne, Quartier UNIL-Chamberonne, Anthropole (EFLE), Bureau 3115, 1015 Lausanne,Switzerland
description: The «Grimm Tradalign» ACR (Alliance Campus Rhodanien / Rhodaniaen Campus Alliance) project is a French-Swiss multidisciplinary venture involving scholars from Grenoble-Alpes University (UGA, France) and the University of Lausanne (UNIL, Switzerland). It aims at developing an alignment tool which leads to the online publication and detailed analysis of a multilingual corpus. The said corpus consists of tales by the Brothers Grimm and their nineteenth and twentieth century translations into French and English This tool is designed to be used with all corpora which require multi-alignment (cases where more than two languages are aligned).

name: Corpus Grammaticorum Latinorum
address: Laboratoire d’Histoire des Théories Linguistiques (UMR 7597 Université Paris Cité/Université Sorbonne Nouvelle/CNRS), Paris 75013
description: A digital index, concordance, lexicon of the Latin artes Grammaticae: Alessandro Garcea and Valeria Lomanto eds, Corpus Grammaticorum Latinorum. A Digital Edition, Paris 2022

name: Corpus of Ioannes Dantiscus' Texts and Correspondence
address: Laboratory for Source Editing and Digital Humanities, Nowy Świat 69, Warszawa, Poland
description: A journey in the footsteps of Dantiscus (1485–1548) – a humanist and world-class diplomat – from the northern outskirts of the multicultural kingdom of the Polish Jagiellons, through the royal and imperial courts of Europe and even into New World at the moment of birth of a new era. In preparation.

name: Desenrollando el cordel/Untangling the cordel
address: Rue Saint-Ours 5, CH-1211 Genève 4
description: A digital library that provides digital editions of 19th century Spanish chapbooks and a catalogue of woodcuts

name: Der Dybbuk by Josef Lateiner
address: Tel Aviv University, Israel
description: The Dybbuk (https://dybbuk.co/) is an ERC funded 5-year research project that sets out to uncover and explore the popular theatre that made up the daily cultural reality of the Jewish masses at the turn of the 20th century. In this framework, four prompter manuscripts are used to decipher, reconstruct, analyse and finally re-enact the 1898 Yiddish play “Der Dybbuk” by Josef Lateiner. Each annotated notebook is provided with facsimile as well as in a joint synoptic edition. The project workflow included a configured annotation workspace.

name: Digital Mishnah
address: École Pratique des Hautes Études, Les Patios Saint-Jacques, 4-14 Rue Ferrus, 75014 Paris, France
description: Nous créons des transcriptions open source des manuscrits principaux des tous les grands traités de la littérature rabbinique tannaïtique grâce à la plateforme eScriptorium et à l'interface de publication TEI-Publisher.

name: Digital Scholarly Editions (DiScholEd)
address: 2 Rue Simone IFF, 75012 Paris, France
description: A platform dedicated to digital scholarly editions of egodocuments

name: Dossier Digital: Alexander von Humboldt y Cuba (1800–1830)
address: La Habana, Cuba
description: Proyecto Humboldt Digital (ProHD) aims to publish online a multilingual collection of texts related to Alexander von Humboldt's trip to Cuba and its reception in the island in the 19th Century.

name: An Edition of the Welsh Merlin Poetry (ISSN 2977-8654)
address: Digital Humanities Team, Library and Collections, Swansea University, Swansea SA2 8PP, UK
description: A scholarly digital edition of Welsh-language Merlin poetry surviving in manuscripts before 1800 with scholarly annotation.

name: EarlyPrint
address: Department of English, Northwestern University, Evanston, IL 60208, USA
description: EarlyPrint presents some 52,000 Early Modern English texts from the EEBO-TCP collection in a linguistically annotated and partially corrected form. The site supports collaborative curation and complex searches via Blacklab, the corpus query tool designed by the Dutch Language Institute. We expect to add Early American texts over the course of the next year.

name: Editionsprogramm »Fraktionen im Deutschen Bundestag 1949–2005«
address: Kommission für Geschichte des Parlamentarismus und der politischen Parteien e.V. (KGParl), Schiffbauerdamm 40, 10117 Berlin, Germany
description: Laufende Edition der historischen Sitzungsprotokolle der Fraktionen im Deutschen Bundestag (1949 bis 2005) durch die »Kommission für die Geschichte des Parlamentarismus und der politischen Parteien e. V.«.

name: Electronic Edition of the works of Jean-Joseph Rabearivelo (french and malagasy)
address: Huma-Num, 54 Boulevard Raspail, 75006 Paris, France
description: In preparation.

name: Elizabeth Montagu Correspondence Online (EMCO)
address: Digital Humanities Team, Swansea University, Swansea SA2 8PP, UK
description: A digital edition of the complete letters of Elizabeth Montagu (1718-1800) - ISSN 2753-9091

name: Exile Letters
address: Institut für vergleichende Städtegeschichte (IStG), Königsstraße 46, 48143 Münster
description: Das Editionsprojekt „Exile Letters“ erschließt, ediert und kommentiert Ego-Dokumente jüdisch-deutscher Geschichte in ihrer regionalen Ausprägung. Im Mittelpunkt stehen die Korrespondenzen jüdischer Familien aus Münster, in denen sich emigrierte und geflohene Familienmitglieder bemühten, den Kontakt zu ihren Angehörigen in Deutschland aufrechtzuerhalten.

name: Foreign Relations of the United States (FRUS)
address: Washington D.C., DC, USA
description: The official documentary record of U.S. foreign relations (1861-)

name: Forest Finns' Letters to Gottlund
address: Finnish Literature Society, Hallituskatu 1, Helsinki, Finland
description: A digital edition of 19th century letters from Forest Finns, Finnish inhabitants of Sweden and Norway, to Carl Axel Gottlund (1796-1875), a Finnish collector of folklore, linguist, university lecturer and activist who sought to improve the Forest Finns' difficult circumstances. The letters are in Finnish, Swedish and Norwegian, the user interface is available in Finnish, Swedish, Norwegian and English. The edition contains facsimile images for all letters and transcriptions for the Finnish letters. XML files are available under CC BY 4.0.

name: Hans Christian Andersen's Fairy Tales and Stories. Translated by John Irons
address: The Hans Christian Andersen Centre at the University of Southern Denmark, Campusvej 55, Odense 5230, Denmark
description: A complete edition from 2022 of all Andersen’s Fairy Tales and Stories. This the first full English edition both available free-of-charge and made by a professional translator who is fluent in English as well as in Danish. Published by the the Hans Christian Andersen Centre at the University of Southern Denmark in Andersen’s home town, Odense.

name: Hasidic Stories
address: Open University, Israel
description: Led by prof. Gadi Sagiv and funded by the Israel Science Foundation, The project aims to study the corpus of all hasidic stories published in Hebrew and Yiddish from the emergence of Hasidism in the middle of the 18th century until 1914. Selected editions are annotated for motives, story types and named entities, and provided with a facsimile.

name: Historical Dictionary of Canon Law in Hispanic America and the Philippines, 16th -18th century (DCH)
address: Max Planck Institute for Legal History and Legal Theory, Hansaallee 41, 60323 Frankfurt am Main, Germany
description: In preparation. From a series of primary sources, it has been developed a thesaurus, comprising 120 voices, that seeks to give a full and particular scenario on the constitutive terms of this legal order in the New World. Articles are worked on the base of a corpus of sources, which circulated widely in Hispanic America and the Philippines in the period studied.

name: J. K. Harju: Folklore of Marginalised People
address: Hallituskatu 1, 00170 Helsinki, Finland
description: A Finnish-only edition of c. 10 000 archival cards recording the lives and traditions of marginalised people in the society, collected by Johan Knut Harju in the 1960s and 1970s: personal accounts of experiencing homelessness and alcohol substitutes, local stories from Helsinki inner city districts, interviews conducted at night shelters, prison and sanatorium traditions, jokes, and youth and wartime reminiscences. Images of archival cards with OCR transcriptions, XML data available under CC BY 4.0.

name: Karl Barth-Gesamtausgabe
address: Karl Barth Archiv, Bruderholzallee 26, Basel, Switzerland
description: Die digitale Karl Barth-Gesamtausgabe präsentiert erstmals frei zugänglich und digital Texte aus der Karl Barth-Gesamtausgabe. Es werden laufend weitere Bände digital aufbereitet.

name: Korespondencja żupnika krakowskiego Mikołaja Serafina z lat 1437 — 1459
address: Sławkowska, Kraków, Poland
description: Niezwykle cenny zbiorek korespondencji prywatnej i urzędowej z połowy XV w. — obejmujący kilkadziesiąt listów z lat 1437–1459 do dzierżawcy salin krakowskich i ruskich, miecznika krakowskiego Mikołaja Serafina lub osób z nim związanych.

name: Lexicon of Greek Personal Names
address: Faculty of Classics, Ioannou Centre for Classical & Byzantine Studies, 66, St. Giles', Oxford, OX1 3LU
description: In beta. LGPN aims to collect and publish with documentation all known ancient Greek personal names (including non-Greek names recorded in Greek, and Greek names in Latin), drawn from all available sources (literature, inscriptions, graffiti, papyri, coins, vases and other artefacts), within the period from the earliest Greek written records, down to, approximately, the sixth century A.D.

name: LGPN-Ling: Etymology and semantics of ancient Greek personal names
address: EPHE, PSL/IUF, ANHIMA, Paris
description: The aim is to elucidate the meaning of Greek names and to provide an essential semantical complement to the LGPN Database.

name: Louis Ginzberg: Legenden der Juden
address: ETH Zürich, Professur für Literatur- und Kulturwissenschaften, Clausiusstrasse 59, Zürich, Switzerland
description: Erstmalige Edition des deutschen Urmanuskripts von Louis Ginzbergs Sammlung jüdischen Erzählguts, deren englische Bearbeitung international weit verbreitet ist

name: Neolatina Sarmatica
address: Gołębia 16, 31-007 Kraków, Poland
description: Neolatina Sarmatica is a repository of critical editions of Latin texts created by authors associated with the former Polish-Lithuanian Commonwealth (Res Publica Utriusque Nationis) consisting of the Kingdom of Poland, Grand Duchy of Lithuania, Royal Prussia, and Duchy of Prussia. Established by the Renaissance Literature Lab at the Faculty of Polish Studies of the Jagiellonian University.

name: Die Nürnberger Briefbücher des 15. Jahrhunderts
address: Kochstraße 4, 91054 Erlangen, Germany
description: Im Projekt wird eine hybride Edition der Nürnberger Briefbücher von 1408 bis 1423 erarbeitet. Die für spätmittelalterliche Kommunikationsprozesse zentrale Quelle wird in sprachwissenschaftlicher bzw. normalisierter Transkription sowie als Faksimile zur Verfügung gestellt.

name: PAVES-e
address: Istituto di Scienze e Tecnologie della Cognizione - CNR | via Gaifami 18, 95126 Catania (Italy) https://g.co/kgs/k7Yf8ZG
description: PAVES-e is a digital and semantic edition of Cesare Pavese’s manuscripts and letters, encoded in TEI-XML and published via TEI Publisher. It aims to offer a philologically accurate, searchable, and accessible resource for literary and linguistic research.

name: Progetto Mambrino Digital Library
address: Via S. Francesco, n. 22, 37129 Verona VR (Italy)
description: A database of digital editions of Italian Romances of Chivalry derived from the famous Spanish genre of libros de caballerías. Each edition of the most famous chivalric cycles (Amadis di Gaula 1546-1568; Palmerino 1544-1566) is integrated within a bibliographic database and accompanied by IIIF source images and semantic lists of characters, places and narrative motifs. The TEI Publisher customized 3-columns visualizer dynamically gather all these materials together. XML data and ODD available under CC BY 4.0, Zenodo community: Progetto Mambrino Digital Library (U. of Verona).

name: Quellen zur Zürcher Geschichte (QZH)
address: Staatsarchiv des Kantons Zürich, Winterthurerstrasse 170, Zürich, Zürich, Switzerland
description: Die Plattform Quellen zur Zürcher Geschichte (QZH) ist der Publikationskanal für Transkriptionen und Digitalisate ausgewählter Quellenstücke aus den Beständen des Staatsarchivs des Kantons Zürich. Sie steht auch für Transkriptionen anderer Institutionen und Kollaborationspartner offen.

name: Rechtsquellen-Edition des Kantons Zürich
address: Staatsarchiv des Kantons Zürich, Winterthurerstrasse 170, Zürich, Zürich, Switzerland
description: Historische Quellen aus dem Gebiet des heutigen Kantons Zürich aus der Zeit bis 1798

name: Zentrale Serien des Kantons Zürich (19. und 20. Jahrhundert)
address: Staatsarchiv des Kantons Zürich, Winterthurerstrasse 170, Zürich, Zürich, Switzerland
description: Die zentralen Serien des Kantons Zürich (ZSZH) umfassen die Offizielle Gesetzessammlung, das Amtsblatt, die Protokolle des Kantonsrats und die Beschlüsse des Regierungsrats.

name: Register of Older Slovenian Manuscripts
address: Research Centre of the Slovenian Academy of Sciences and Arts, Novi trg 2, 1000 Ljubljana, Slovenia
description: Descriptions of manuscripts in Slovenian language from early modern period, some of them with a digital facsimile.

name: Slovenian Baroque Literature
address: Research Centre of the Slovenian Academy of Sciences and Arts, Novi trg 2, 1000 Ljubljana, Slovenia
description: A collection of diplomatic editions of Slovenian manuscripts from the Baroque period, largely unknown until recently. The time span ranges from the 17th century with extensions into the early 19th century.

name: Thebarum Fabula
address: Universidad Autónoma de Madrid
description: Biblioteca digital del mito tebano con editiones criticas y traducciones. Un sitio Web de acceso libre que sirva de repositorio exhaustivo de recursos, ediciones críticas estándares y traducciones recientes de las obras griegas y romanas que versan sobre las luchas fratricidas de los Terrigenae y de los hijos de Edipo, Eteocles y Polinices.

name: The Salomon project
address: Seminar für mittelalterliche Geschichte | Eberhard Karls Universität Tübingen | Wilhelmstr. 12, 72074 Tübingen
description: The Salomon project presents an introduction to the early medieval ‘prognostic table of Salomon’ (Tabula pronostica Salomonis) as well as transcriptions and translations of some of its different versions. It is an attempt to make complex historical sources accessible to a wider audience through open digital presentation methods.

name: Sand and Stars
address: Haifa University, Israel
description: Sand and Stars (https://www.dzi.de/ueber-uns/geschichte/digitalisierungsprojekt-sand-und-sterne/), a project funded by DZI – Deutsches Zentralinstitut für soziale Fragen, builds a synoptic trilingual annotated edition of the unpublished novel by Sidonie Wronsky, (Berlin, 1882–Jerusalem, 1947) who was an notable Jewish German social reformist and social worker, active in both the German welfare system and later in the Jewish community in Mandatory Palestine.

name: Sammlung Schweizerischer Rechtsquellen online (SSRQ online)
address: Rechtsquellenstiftung des Schweizerischen Juristenvereins, Tigerbergstrasse 21, St. Gallen, Switzerland
description: Rechtshistorisches Quellenmaterial vom Mittelalter bis in die Frühe Neuzeit (1798).

name: Siege of Antioch Project (SAP)
address: Fordham Center for Medieval Studies, Fordham University, New York
description: The Siege of Antioch Project (“SAP”) presents an original digital edition of a newly edited and translated medieval Siège d’Antioche, an Old French poetic account of the First Crusade with a heavy emphasis on the taking of Antioch and the subsequent battle. It is a collaborative effort currently being undertaken by U.K. scholars and graduate students in the Fordham Medieval Studies program.

name: SKVR: Database of Karelian, Ingrian and Finnish Folk Poems
address: Hallituskatu 1, 00170 Helsinki, Finland
description: A database of c. 90 000 Karelian, Ingrian and Finnish folk poems, originally published by the Finnish Literature Society in 34 volumes in 1908–1948 and 1997. Another c. 80 000 previously unpublished poems will be added by the end of 2024. XML data is available under CC BY 4.0.

name: The Digital Cassirer Collection
address: Sheffield Institute for Interdisciplinary Biblical Studies, The University of Sheffield, Sheffield, UK
description: The collected works of H. W. Cassirer (1903­-1979), philosopher, classicist and biblical scholar.

name: The International Business Correspondence of L. Kniffler & Co. (1859-1876)
address: Ruhr-Universität Bochum, Universitätsstraße 150, 44801 Bochum, Germany
description: A digital edition of the international business correspondence of L. Kniffler & Co., one of the first European or American trading houses established in Japan after the Shogunate dropped its isolationist policy.

name: TraveLab
address: Haifa University, Israel
description: TraveLab is a project that explores new ways to read Historical travelogs, combining an interactive map with aligned parallel editions. Starting with a trilingual edition of the Journey of Benjamin of Tudela, a Jewish 12th century traveler, the project will continue to integrate additional Travelogs. XML files are available under CC BY 4.0.

name: Travel Journals of Johann Conrad Fischer 1794–1851
address: Stiftung Eisenbibliothek, Klostergut Paradies, 8252 Schlatt TG / Schweiz
description: Digital edition of the travel journals of Johann Conrad Fischer (1773–1854), Swiss scientist, entrepreneur and pioneer during the Industrial Revolution. The texts are published in the original German and in English for the first time. They are enriched with itineraries, register data on persons, companies and places as well as numerous images.

name: Die Urkunden und Akten des Klosters und des Oberamts Königsfelden. 1308-1662
address: Staatsarchiv Aargau, Entfelderstrasse 22, 5001 Aarau
description: Die digitale Edition «Die Urkunden und Akten des Klosters und des Oberamts Königsfelden», herausgegeben von Colette Halter-Pernet, Tobias Hodel und Simon Teuscher, wird von Bibliothek und Archiv Aargau gepflegt und präsentiert die Dokumente nicht nur als hochauflösende Digitalisate, sondern gibt auch den lateinischen oder frühneuhochdeutschen Wortlaut wieder.

name: Vicentino21 – a digital edition with commentary, translation and practical exploration of Nicola Vicentino’s «L’antica musica ridotta alla moderna prattica» (Rome 1555) (in preparation)
address: Schola Cantorum Basiliensis, Leonhardsstrasse 6, Basel, Switzerland
description: “Vicentino21” is a four year SNFS project and is creating a digital edition of the treatise and its music, with translations, commentaries and sound samples. The textual part of the treatise will be encoded in TEI and the TEI Publisher will be our publishing tool.

name: Wilhelm von Humboldt: Schriften
address: This edition is independent and not affiliated with any institution. The marker indicates Schloss Tegel.
description: An independent digital edition of Wilhelm von Humboldt's (1767–1835) complete works, presented in a modern, accessible, and sustainable format. The ongoing project offers TEI-encoded texts in a fully searchable and user-friendly interface.
